etymology.description: semantic: 𠂇 (“left hand”) + 又 (“right hand”) — both hands; also written 𠬞.
etymology.interpretation: Combines the left and right hands to depict a pair of hands acting together, hence the sense of lifting or offering with both hands. Its form later served as a common component in characters related to holding or presenting.

examples.chinese: 在古文字中，廾表示两只手一起举起东西(在古文字中，廾表示兩隻手一起舉起東西)。
examples.pinyin: Zài gǔ wénzì zhōng, gǒng biǎoshì liǎng zhī shǒu yīqǐ jǔqǐ dōngxī.
examples.english: In ancient script, 廾 signifies two hands lifting something together.

examples.chinese: 作为部件，它常见于表示双手奉献或合举的字，如奉、奏(作為部件，它常見於表示雙手奉獻或合舉的字，如奉、奏)。
examples.pinyin: Zuòwéi bùjiàn, tā chángjiàn yú biǎoshì shuāngshǒu fèngxiàn huò héjǔ de zì, rú Fèng, Zòu.
examples.english: As a component, it appears in characters that depict offering or jointly lifting with two hands, such as 奉 and 奏.
